resources.string: No need, Development settings are enabled by default.
Enable the Android Debug Bridge (adb) interface
Display a notification when USB or network debugging is enabled
Enable TCP/IP debugging over network interfaces (Wi\u2011Fi, USB networks). This setting is reset on reboot

WARNING: When ADB over network is enabled, your phone is open for intrusions on all connected networks!

Only use this feature when you are connected on trusted networks.

Do you really want to enable this function?

Disabled\nAdd an entry to enable this feature
Removing every %1$s in the list will disable the feature entirely.
, while selecting the icon will bring up customization options

To add a %1$s, select the Add icon. Once a %1$s is added, selecting the row will change the target%2$s

To remove a %1$s, swipe the row horizontally left or right. Re-order a %1$s in the list by vertically dragging the anchor on the left.

To clear or reset to defaults, select the Reset icon.
Removing every %1$s in the list will disable the second pie layer entirely.

The chosen app did not return a valid icon or does not support image cropping. Use another app.

Lights in Do Not Disturb mode
Check the proximity sensor prior to waking up screen
Wake up device if charger is plugged/unplugged
Allowing apps to have root access upon request has the potential to be very dangerous!
When Privacy Guard is enabled, the app will not be able to access personal data such as contacts, messages or call logs.
When enabling Privacy Guard for a built-in app, the app will not be able to access or provide personal data. This may cause other apps to misbehave.
Enable by default for newly-installed apps
Manage which apps have access to your personal data

In this screen you can choose which apps Privacy Guard should be active for by simply tapping on them. Selected apps will not be able to access your personal data such as contacts, messages or call logs. Long pressing an app\'s entry opens its app details screen.\n\nBuilt-in apps are not shown by default but can be revealed by selecting the respective menu option.
Are you sure you wish to reset counters?
Superuser indicator is visible when a session is active
Toggle to show superuser indicator when a session is active
Allow unlocked data access to your phone\'s storage through USB (MTP, PTP)

Your device will establish unprotected connections, everytime you connect it to a PC. Secured lock screens disable this option automatically.\n\nThis is still an experimental feature, use with caution.
Double tap on the status bar to put the device to sleep
